programmes.show_description: Truls Mørk performs Shostakovich's first cello concerto with the German Symphony Orchestra, Berlin. Plus music by Anna Thorvaldsdóttir James Kimo Williams and Grieg.
Tom McKinney presents Radio 3's Breakfast show. To get in touch, email 3breakfast@bbc.co.uk.
Georgia Mann plays the best in classical music, with discoveries and surprises rubbing shoulders with familiar favourites.
Fiona Talkington introduces an afternoon of specially made recordings including a live concert from Wigmore Hall with violinist Hana Chang and pianist Elisabeth Brauss.

programmes.show_name: Composer of the Week: Amy Beach
programmes.show_description: 1/5. Donald Macleod explores how Amy Beach railed against the sexism of her time to journey from a child piano prodigy to a respected composer.
Katie Derham presents live music from singers Beverley Knight and Ntombizodwa Ndlovu, with guitarist Shirley Tetteh, plus violinist Pekka Kuusisto and folk musician Sam Amidon.
Take time out with a 30-minute soundscape including music by Evelyn Glennie, Grieg, Corelli, Milhaud, William Grant Smith and Lili Boulanger.
Vasily Petrenko conducts the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra at the Glasshouse in Gateshead in Tchaikovsky's Piano Concerto No.1 and Shostakovich's Symphony No.10.
...Progress Street - series 2. Dr Rommi Smith examines the music and contributions of five leading Black female musicians, to civil rights and social change.
Sara Mohr-Pietsch presents an adventurous, immersive soundtrack for late-night listening, from classical to contemporary and everything in between.
Soweto welcomes American jazz pianist Aaron Parks as his Monday to Thursday guest for 4/4.
Nature forms the inspiration for this song recital from Madrid.
Tom McKinney presents Radio 3's Breakfast show. To get in touch, email 3breakfast@bbc.co.uk.
Georgia Mann plays the best in classical music, with discoveries and surprises rubbing shoulders with familiar favourites.
Fiona Talkington introduces an afternoon of specially made recordings including Berlioz's Harold in Italy symphony and recent studio recordings by Radio 3's New Generaton Artists.

programmes.show_name: Composer of the Week: Amy Beach
programmes.show_description: 2/5. Donald explores the story behind the 'first Symphony by an American woman' - Amy Beach's 'Gaelic' Symphony of 1897.
Tim Garland and Geoffrey Keezer play live and Katie chats to conductor Kevin John Edusei.
Take time out with a 30-minute soundscape of classical music.
Adam Hickox conducts the BBC Philharmonic Orchestra in Rachmaninov's Symphonic Dances. Elisabeth Brauss joins them for Ravel's Piano Concerto in G.
...Progress Street - series 2. Dr Rommi Smith examines the music and contributions of five leading Black female musicians, to civil rights and social change.
Sara Mohr-Pietsch presents an adventurous, immersive soundtrack for late-night listening, from classical to contemporary and everything in between.
Soweto is joined once again by his 4/4 guest this week, Aaron Parks, who has another album to share that has inspired him.
